Page.title: ismip-hom-c
Page.description:
The Ice Sheet Model Intercomparison Project for Higher-Order Models (ISMIP-HOM) prescribes a set of experiments meant to test the implementation of higher-order physics. The results of this benchmark experiment was published in The Cryosphere and can be found here.

Experiment C (shown here), simulates a parallel-sided slab of ice lying on a sloped bed that has a sinusoidally oscillating basal friction coefficient. The experimental domain is a square of side length L, with periodic boundary conditions applied in the horizontal. The ice thickness is 1000 m, the slope is 0.1 ° (maximum in x, zero in y), the basal friction coefficient is perscribed by β(x,y)= 1000 + 1000 sin(ωx)*sin(ωy), and the frequency of the oscillations is ω = 2 π/L.
Page.Data:
ismip-hom-c

The Ice Sheet Model Intercomparison Project for Higher-Order Models (ISMIP-HOM) prescribes a set of experiments meant to test the implementation of higher-order physics. The results of this benchmark experiment was published in The Cryosphere and can be found here.

Experiment C (shown here), simulates a parallel-sided slab of ice lying on a sloped bed that has a sinusoidally oscillating basal friction coefficient. The experimental domain is a square of side length L, with periodic boundary conditions applied in the horizontal. The ice thickness is 1000 m, the slope is 0.1 ° (maximum in x, zero in y), the basal friction coefficient is perscribed by β(x,y)= 1000 + 1000 sin(ωx)*sin(ωy), and the frequency of the oscillations is ω = 2 π/L.
